column4: hm, does anyone know if wine for amd64 in the repo is actually a 64 bit package and not a hack?
what repo did you find that in? Have you tried 'apt-cache show wine'?
http://wine.budgetdedicated.com
no amd64 packages in sight...
http://wine.budgetdedicated.com/apt/pool/main/w/wine/ sorry there's aamd64 package there for feisty
downloading, will have a look
never mind its the same 32bit package apparently depends on ia32
yes, the package list indicates that
do you know about the chroot option?
what? no, what about it?
to run inherently-32bit software on an amd64 arch system, set up a 32bit chroot environment. Ubotu has more, see private message
it's more work than grafting 32bit libs in, but it's a cleaner solution.
no, it's a text-based GUI
yea i understand but it doesnt need nothing meaning i can run it through ssh?
you can
is that relevant to the chipset [KS] uses?
what do you suggest to install from backports? ([KS])
^^ it has latest iwlwifi driver
pretty sure the backports package needs the most recent kernel...
im thinking he should ditch backports if hes having troubles with -17 kernel
no X, so 'sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf' [KS]
oh i see sorry then
I just thought that the instructions would come in handy
